alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:30AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Douglas, eastern Chelan, northwestern Lincoln, southwestern Stevens, southwestern Ferry, southeastern Okanogan and northeastern Grant Counties through 800 AM PDT... At 729 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 15 miles northeast of Rock Island to 21 miles northwest of Davenport. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Ephrata reported wind gusts to 40 mph as these showers moved through in the past hour. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chelan, Banks Lake South, Douglas, Lincoln, Waterville, Coulee Dam, Grand Coulee, Electric City, Wilbur, Coulee City, Mansfield, Almira, Elmer City, Creston, Hartline, Sims Corner, Govan, Withrow, Spring Canyon Campground, and Alstown. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 150 and 238. U.S. Highway 97 in Washington between mile markers 227 and 241. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Upper Columbia Basin; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
